title: Bomber‚Äôs parting shot for outgoing chairman
text:
Brendon Goddard whacks outgoing AFL chairman Mike Fitzpatrick over supplements saga handling  30pm by Staff Writers Source: FOX SPORTS OUTGOING AFL chairman Mike Fitzpatrick said on Wednesday that he remained ‚Äútotally comfortable‚Äù with the league‚Äôs handling of the Essendon supplements scandal. 
But one Bomber didn‚Äôt take too kindly to that statement. 
Fitzpatrick announced his retirement as AFL chairman on Wednesday after 10 years in the role, which included overseeing the Bombers‚Äô doping saga and the players‚Äô suspensions, as well as negotiating with anti-doping authorities during a turbulent four-season period. 
While he wouldn‚Äôt have liked to deal with the issue in the first place, Fitzpatrick said he believed the league handled it appropriately. 
‚ÄúIt was a really difficult issue ... (but) I‚Äôm comfortable with the way we dealt with it.‚Äù 
But Essendon veteran Brendon Goddard wasn‚Äôt happy with Fitzpatrick‚Äôs comments. 
In reply to Herald Sun journalist Glenn McFarlane‚Äôs paraphrased quote of Fitzpatrick, Goddard took to Twitter to voice his displeasure. 
‚Äú ... what ever (sic) helps you sleep at night Mike!‚Äù Goddard tweeted with a confused emoji alongside. @MaccaHeraldSun @superfooty ü§î what ever helps you sleep at night Mike! ‚Äî Brendon Goddard (@BrendonGoddard9) February 15, 2017 
Goddard wasn‚Äôt one of the 34 past and present Essendon players that copped doping bans in January 2016, as he was at St Kilda during the 2012 injection program. 
However Goddard had to shoulder a big burden in 2016 as he was appointed captain of a depleted Bombers line-up that was missing 12 players due to suspension. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
